channel.title: kanji on constantly walking
channel.description: Recent content in kanji on constantly walking

item.title: Kanji Book
item.description: This started out as an attempt to sort kanji by readings and ended up as a handbound reference book with all of the wanikani kanji, sorted by the first mostly onyomi reading. There are two ways to print these. As full sized sheets to be bound on the long edge. Printed with plain font or with the stroke order font. As smaller pages to be printed in signatures and bound in a book using any number of hand binding techniques.

item.title: Waniakani Vocabulary
item.description: Wanikani uses a structured repetition system as the backbone of its approach to teaching the kanji. To help reinforce the readings it also has a ton of vocabulary to learn. To help me keep track of this vocubulary and get some extra reading practice I have created some printable vocabulary sheets. Think of these as cheat sheets or study aids rather than as flashcards. Wankikani vocabulary, levels 1 – 20 Wankikani vocabulary, levels 21 – 40 Wankikani vocabulary, levels 41 – 60

item.title: Writing Practice
item.description: These writing practice sheets are intended as clear, efficient and clutter-free printable worksheets for practicing japanese writing with a pen, pencil, brush or brush pen. They have no english translations, and in the case of kanji, just a single, often onyomi reading. The point here is focusing on the character, keeping out english clutter and not including all linguistic information you might want about the item. kana ひらがな / a4 paper ひらがな / a4 paper, smaller characters カタカナ / a4 paper カタカナ / a4 paper, smaller characters kanji These grew out of my use of Wanikani and online (paid) service for learning a great many kanji.

item.title: Wanikani goods
item.description: Wanikani has been a great way to study the kanji. What is also great about it, is the open data framework that it employs, enabling anyone who joins to get access to a huge data set of kanji, readings, meanings, mnenomics, levels in WK, JLPT, JOYO, etc. This data can be used for all kinds of purposes – I have used it as input for various projects including:
